intro: Epidendrum fractiflexum, commonly known as the flexile epidendrum, is a species of orchid native to Mexico. It is characterized by its drooping, pendulous inflorescences and clusters of fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in tropical and subtropical environments. Its leaves are usually elongated and革质 (leathery), providing structural support and aiding in water retention. Epidendrum fractiflexum is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and relatively easy care requirements.
